verses.verse: For the Chief Musician; set to the Gittith. A Psalm of Asaph. Sing aloud <S%H7321><s%> unto God <S%H430><s%> our strength <S%H5797><s%>: Make a joyful noise <S%H7321><s%> unto the God <S%H430><s%> of Jacob <S%H3290><s%>.
Raise <S%H5375><s%> a song <S%H2172><s%>, and bring <S%H5414><s%> hither the timbrel <S%H8596><s%>, The pleasant <S%H5273><s%> harp <S%H3658><s%> with the psaltery <S%H5035><s%>.
Blow <S%H8628><s%> the trumpet <S%H7782><s%> at the new moon <S%H2320><s%>, At the full moon <S%H2320><s%>, on our feast <S%H2282><s%> - day <S%H3117><s%>.
For it is a statute <S%H2706><s%> for Israel <S%H3478><s%>, An ordinance <S%H4941><s%> of the God <S%H430><s%> of Jacob <S%H3290><s%>.

He appointed <S%H7760><s%> it in Joseph <S%H3084><s%> for a testimony <S%H5715><s%>, When he went out <S%H3318><s%> over the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt <S%H4714><s%>, Where I heard <S%H8085><s%> a language <S%H8193><s%> that I knew not <S%H3045><s%>.
I removed <S%H5493><s%> his shoulder <S%H7926><s%> from the burden <S%H5447><s%>: His hands <S%H3709><s%> were freed <S%H5674><s%> from the basket <S%H1731><s%>.

Thou calledst <S%H7121><s%> in trouble <S%H6869><s%>, and I delivered <S%H2502><s%> thee <S%H6030><s%>; I answered thee in the secret place <S%H5643><s%> of thunder <S%H7482><s%>; I proved <S%H974><s%> thee at the waters <S%H4325><s%> of Meribah <S%H4809><s%>. <S%H5542><s%>[[Selah
Hear <S%H8085><s%>, O my people <S%H5971><s%>, and I will testify <S%H5749><s%> unto thee <S%H3478><s%>: O Israel, if thou wouldest hearken unto me <S%H8085><s%>!
There shall no strange <S%H2114><s%> god <S%H410><s%> be in thee <S%H7812><s%>; Neither shalt thou worship any foreign <S%H5236><s%> god <S%H410><s%>.

I am Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> thy God <S%H430><s%>, Who brought <S%H5927><s%> thee up out of the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt <S%H4714><s%>: Open thy mouth <S%H6310><s%> wide <S%H7337><s%>, and I will fill it <S%H4390><s%>.
But my people <S%H5971><s%> hearkened <S%H8085><s%> not to my voice <S%H6963><s%>; And Israel <S%H3478><s%> would none of me <S%H14><s%>.
So I let them go <S%H7971><s%> after the stubbornness <S%H8307><s%> of their heart <S%H3820><s%>, That they might walk <S%H3212><s%> in their own counsels <S%H4156><s%>.
Oh <S%H3863><s%> that my people <S%H5971><s%> would hearken <S%H8085><s%> unto me <S%H3478><s%>, That Israel would walk <S%H1980><s%> in my ways <S%H1870><s%>!
I would soon <S%H4592><s%> subdue <S%H3665><s%> their enemies <S%H341><s%>, And turn <S%H7725><s%> my hand <S%H3027><s%> against their adversaries <S%H341><s%>.
The haters <S%H8130><s%> of Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> should submit <S%H3584><s%> themselves unto him <S%H6256><s%>: But their time should endure for ever <S%H5769><s%>.
He would feed <S%H398><s%> them also with the finest <S%H2459><s%> of the wheat <S%H2406><s%>; And with honey <S%H1706><s%> out of the rock <S%H6697><s%> would I satisfy thee <S%H7646><s%>.
